content: The Act may be cited as the "Extension of Section 420 and Retiree Life Insurance Act of 2012" and extends transfers of excess pension assets to retiree health accounts. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to extend the deadline to December 31, 2021. The Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974 is also amended to change dates to January 1, 2022. The amendments take effect on the date of enactment. The Act allows for the transfer of excess pension assets to retiree group term life insurance accounts. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to include an applicable life insurance account for health benefits. This account is defined as a separate account for qualified current retiree liabilities based on premiums for applicable life insurance benefits. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to include applicable life insurance benefits for retired employees entitled to coverage and pension benefits.
